intro: Rhoeadia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered rhoeadia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes with cool, moist conditions. Its showy yellow to orange flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Rhoeadia grandiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitats.
